adrFormatAddress: 59 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Casual hideaway for Chinese fare with a focus on dim sum, plus happy-hour food specials.

originalText.text:
Dim Sum Palace offers an array of quality dim sum selections. The standout dishes during our visit were the steamed and soup dumplings, the stir-fried turnip cake, along with the sticky rice. The fried milk was an unexpected delight with a perfect blend of light, crispy texture and creamy flavor that worked well as a dessert.

The restaurant was also accommodating of our nut-free and vegetarian preferences. They were able to quickly identify dishes containing nuts and offer several meat-free options/adjustments upon request, which we appreciate.

text.text:
Dim Sum Palace offers an array of quality dim sum selections. The standout dishes during our visit were the steamed and soup dumplings, the stir-fried turnip cake, along with the sticky rice. The fried milk was an unexpected delight with a perfect blend of light, crispy texture and creamy flavor that worked well as a dessert.

The restaurant was also accommodating of our nut-free and vegetarian preferences. They were able to quickly identify dishes containing nuts and offer several meat-free options/adjustments upon request, which we appreciate.

originalText.text:
Had family in over the holidays and Dim Sum Palace was able to accommodate our 20 person crew on short notice.

The owner greeted us personally on arrival and brought us to their private room which was set up and ready for us.

The group had 10 children in the mix and was prompt to take our drink order and get some appetizers going for the table while the rest of us figured out what mains we wanted.

The portions of the main dishes are perfect to share family style.

We had multiple orders of  cucumbers w Szechuan sauce , lettuce wraps, pork chive dumplings, shrimp dumplings, bbq pork buns, seafood shu mai, scallion pancakes, fried spring rolls to start.

For our mains we had Singapore Mei fun, Hong Kong pan fried noodle, pineapple fried rice w chicken, pork fried rice, sesame chicken, bok choy, sautéed asparagus, kung pow chicken, moo shu pork, and Mongolian beef.

The order came out correct, perfect temperature, and it was a delight to eat after a long day in the city.

We appreciate the great customer service, the sizable portions, the fresh and authentic taste, and the staff for making us feel very welcomed.

originalText.text:
Dim Sum Palace on Division ST.

The good:
- Open till 04:00 AM.
- Many of the standard dim sum selections, plus a few out of the usual items.

The not so good:
- A bit more pricier than your common lesser known dim sum places.
- but as well, since covid, prices for dim sum has increased across the board.

Summary: a good dim sum option, albeit it a bit higher in pricing than your more common places.

originalText.text: The chicken feet was the best I have had so far. Excellent lotus wrapped rice and soup dumplings. Shu mai and shrimp dumplings were equally great. Was not a fan of the ribs as it was too fatty. I would want to try out more dimsum items and some of the sharing dishes next time.

text.text: The chicken feet was the best I have had so far. Excellent lotus wrapped rice and soup dumplings. Shu mai and shrimp dumplings were equally great. Was not a fan of the ribs as it was too fatty. I would want to try out more dimsum items and some of the sharing dishes next time.

originalText.text: Great spot for dim sum! We appreciated ordering by checkbox on the menu. Our table really enjoyed the Peking duck and I was happy with how many vegetarian options there were.
